messages.title: Working Hard for Worsley and Eccles South
messages.content: Barbara is known as a committed community campaigner and strong voice in parliament for Worsley and Eccles South.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposing the privatisation of our NHS, supporting the campaign to keep the Walk-in Centre open in Eccles.
Campaigning for more affordable homes, including homes to rent, and for the bedroom tax to be scrapped.
Fighting for police cuts to be reversed and community policing to be protected.
Taking action on the cost of living crisis by helping residents with the cost of food, childcare, and energy bills.

issues.health: Opposing the privatisation of our NHS, supporting the campaign to keep the Walk-in Centre open in Eccles.
issues.socialWelfare: Campaigning for more affordable homes, including homes to rent, and for the bedroom tax to be scrapped.

housing.content: Campaigning for more affordable homes, including homes to rent, and for the bedroom tax to be scrapped.

politicalExperience.achievements: Her achievements include influencing the government to drop proposals for 'Pay to Stay' & fighting for compensation for Women Against State Pension Inequality.
